intro: Matuda-pina, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to South America. It features dense, glossy green foliage and produces small, red, fleshy berries that are highly aromatic. The plant has a woody trunk with a rough, flaky bark and can grow up to 10 meters tall in optimal conditions. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. The botanical characteristics of Matuda-pina make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
